title: Admin Associate 5 Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process, although it takes a while to be called back after applying for any of the jobs. The interview process was a video interview first, then an in-person interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? Tell me about your work-related experiences.

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Applied through HR. Its a two step process. First round of interview with Manager and next round of interview with HR. The entire process took less than two weeks and it was so pleasant.
Interview Questions:
General questions regarding how you see customers?
Situtational questions

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: My position came directly from my advisor thus there isnt a real interview process, for those trying to get a position from the department directly they mostly look at your overall Gpa and your Gpa for the classes they need TA for.
Interview Questions: There isnt an interview process for me.

title: Endocrinology Fellow Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: 3-4 virtual interviews with faculty members and then a virtual meeting with 2-3 fellows. One of the interviews was with the chief of endocrinology and another one was with the program director.
Interview Questions: Tell me about an interesting case

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: the interviewing professor was friendly and manipulated the conversation smoothly  so he could check on my knowledge and enthusiasm without causing any flaws to me such as anxiety or being nervous.
Interview Questions: what is your opinion about the paper you were assigned to read about?

title: Graphic Designer and Brand Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer rattled off all of the duties that this job required (which were a LOT). She then told me the appallingly low salary offer for this type of position. When I told her I could not take the job for that low of a salary (because I literally couldn’t live off of what she was offering), she was incredibly rude and acted as if I was being unreasonable.
Interview Questions: Does this sound like something you’d be interested in?

title: Student Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview, an in person interview, and the opportunity to give a job talk.  The time from application to initial interview was incredibly long. Once I was at the in person interview I was able to meet a lot of people on staff since I was there for an entire work day.
Interview Questions: The job talk was focused on the departments area of focus. They also asked me a lot of personality question related to personality testing.

title: Accounting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Called within a couple months of applying, went in for an interview, and they let me know that I got the job the next day. Simple, to-the-point interview. They described the position and what I would be doing and then we just talked about my resume and they pulled questions from that.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience following UT policy?

title: Accounting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: I had one in person interview, but the process took about a month from application to hire. There were two people interviewing and it took about an hour. Very laid back.
Interview Questions: Weakness/Strengths, Why leaving current position

title: Physical Therapy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I had an online conversation to learn a little about what the job would entail before I went in for the interview that included multiple staff. The next steps would have included drug screening, background check, flu shot, and training.
Interview Questions: How would you handle when multiple people are wanting your attention and there is other noise in the background?

title: Grad Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Very short -> A department chair called me and offered me money. I took the money. This may seem too brief, but the department already possessed my file due to my application, so they reviewed the file and offered me based on their current knowledge of me.
Interview Questions: "Do you want to attend the University of Tennessee?" "Do you have experience teaching/leading"

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: You need to apply to graduate school with resume statement of purpose and research interests. The after few weeks you will be emailed the decision on you application. Once you get the admission you need to reply saying that you would be joining
Interview Questions: what research area are you interested in

title: Conference Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: My interview was over the phone and brief but insightful. There is a large focus on leadership and diversity. The process was quick and to direct as well. I really enjoyed the questions that were geared toward understanding customer service.
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you?

title: Communications Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted by phone and lasted about 20 minutes, which felt very rushed. There were seven people 7 people asking questions and providing no feedback. The questions  were very broad. I believe that face-to-face interviews provide a more accurate look at candidates.
Interview Questions: Three words to describe myself.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Simple process only involving contacting and speaking with potential advisor. Once a connection is made, the advisor contacted HR to draw up contract offer.  Decision on whether I got the position was made fast and with transparency.
Interview Questions: where was your undergraduate degree obtained?

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: It is a researcher position. It is direct hire - No interview involved. Why it has to be 30 words limit if there was not interviewed at all. Hi, hi, hi, hi
Interview Questions: Direct hire, not interviewed

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: The process was very open ended, many questions about diversity and inclusion. Questions about community development as well. You can expect this for all GA's positions that are available for graduate students.
Interview Questions: If you could implement one movement or policy, what would you implement?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Basic personal questions asking bout your past work experience, your personality, and your skills. It was not difficult. Know your strengths and weaknesses going in and you'll be fine. Think back on your work experience about some customer service experience you've had
Interview Questions: Name 3 strengths and 3 weaknesses you have.

title: Full Time Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: They needed a package uploaded via email which included a letter of intent and resume and cover letter ... then invite for an interview ........there were about 4,5 committee members and they asked questions taht were kind of easy
Interview Questions:
years of teaching experience?
teaching goals?

title: IT Team Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Star questions. straight forward. managers are pretty plain but well educated. Dress well to go to the interview. have questions prepped for them. be sure to send a thank you letter after your interview
Interview Questions: how you work with difficult fellow employees

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Contacted me for interview and guided me through conference call set-up.  Pleasant experience with all involved. Several people were on the call and all asked questions.  They appeared to listen intently and give me consideration.  Easy and smooth process. Should have let me known sooner that I was not moving through to the next phase.
Interview Questions: What do you see as success of the program in 1 yr? 5 yrs?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Tennessee in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Zoom meeting, asked good questions to ensure a quality fit for this role. Described what kind of job they needed done, and what their hypotheses before data analysis. Fun people, they were very easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Do you like working with numbers?

title: Administrative Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview with 2 people.  Later that day, I was asked to come in for an in-person interview the next day.  It was a panel interview consisting of 3 people.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Search committee of 4 people.  First round of general interview questions, then one on one interview with the department manager, then open team interview.  Standard and straightforward process
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in working for UT?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was called and then went for a visit. After that I was given an offer, and I happily accepted. It was a relatively simple process. Not sure what else to add.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Social Media Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Pretty simple. The job was actually designed and I was asked if I wanted it. I was then emailed to come by an receive my offer letter. It was pretty straight forward.
Interview Questions: Do you want the job?

title: Communications Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Great interview experience.  Felt well-respected all the way through.  Started with a phone interview. Met with the selection committee and team members making the decision for the position.  Only drawback was the length of time between meeting, my follow-ups and the actual notification of their decision.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I walked into a conference room, and my boss went down my resume asking me what I did in each role. I came prepared with my resume, dressed professionally, and discussed my previous employment. It was a very relaxed interview as the position I was applying for does not require many technical skills.
Interview Questions: What did you learn from your time in ...?

title: Administrative Support Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview for the position and was hired to work as a temporary employee. I basically told them about what I had done and what I felt my strengths were. I told my interviewer about my skills, how I hoped to grow in the position, and what my favorite aspects of my previous jobs were. We talked about the expectations of the position and I was offered the job. I started work within about a week.
Interview Questions:
Tell me more about your experience as an administrative assistant.
What did you enjoy most about your work?
Why did you leave your last employer?

title: Temporary Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief and to the point.  Took only about 10 minutes.  Met face to face with the head of HR who contacted me about the position, she advised all documentation I would need for the background check, who I would be interviewing with, where to park the day of the interview.  Interviewed directly with my supervisor who asked me a minimum of questions and she hired me then and there.
Interview Questions: Previous office experince, computer skills.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Tennessee in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview followed by an on-campus interview. The interviewer was comfortable and gave good opportunities for the interviewee to speak. If you are not from the area, you will need to get a parking pass or request one from your department. Parking can be a pain, so be sure to arrive early.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous teaching experience and how it has prepared you for this position.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions: Easy, quick interview. They had already read through my supporting documents and knew about my experiences, education, and research. Some GRA positions do not interview, you just get automatically selected by your dept but this was a special grant hiring process.
Interview Questions: How does your experience relate to STEM education?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee
Interview Descriptions:
Short and concise, no tricky questions.  Look at motivated people. This is not a 8 to 5 job.
Exempt positions requiere to work from home sometimes on weekends.
Look for independent, team-oriented and accountable people
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty straight forwards with few questions regarding my project vision. As I was referred by an employee, it did not take much time for the final offer to receive in my favor. Wonderful place to work.
Interview Questions: How do you see the project evolve in 1 year?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was as simple as expressing my interest in the research professor's research. You need to research what they work on prior to meeting with them. If you are not interested in what they work on you will not get the position. I worked in two engineering research labs.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested

title: Medical Administrative Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the manager and the office director and they were both really nice and down to earth. It was a breeze. They told me about the office and the history of the office and spoke a little bit about the docs and the residents.
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself

title: Administrative Support Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied through taleo, then I got a phone call a month later in regards to an interview. The interview environment was nice and calm. The ladies there took me back to meet the head of the department and four of them sat with me to talk. The overall interview was an hour and fifteen minutes long and we discussed a lot of things. It was perhaps the most positive and welcoming interview I have ever had.
Interview Questions: What is the hardest part of your current job?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Memphis, TN) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions, some questions about the skills and some personality questions,mix of both. It depends on the department if you would get one on one interview or with the a panel. Friendly environment.
Interview Questions: If you have previous research experience

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: They sent me the hours and asked for me to send in an application. They then emailed me for an interview. When i came in they had two individuals interviewing me for the position.
Interview Questions: Why would you be good at this job?

title: Landscape Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: short and disorganized, they basically just told me i was over qualified and asked if i really wanted the job.  when i got here, it was unclear on where i was to go and then i had to wait in a dirty makeshift conference room
Interview Questions: do you have experience

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position via email in response to an ad I found on UT's website. Several weeks later I received a response letting me know I was chosen to set up and interview. The interview was conducted through facetime, and was with all three of the supervisors.
Interview Questions: If I did not know the answer to a question being asked of me how would I go about finding the answer to it?

title: Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I went in. They Talked. I answered. It was a great process. I don't know what else to say here. The whole process was great and easy and they were nice.
Interview Questions: How did you find us?

title: Gameroom Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Martin, TN)
Interview Descriptions: No real interview process. Get the job by buddying up with a current worker.
Interview Questions: Simply asked when I could start.

title: Public Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via the HR job site, and then was contacted by phone to schedule an in-person panel interview with the PR & Marketing staff (there was no phone interview beforehand). There was a second in-person interview with higher ups in the university (Vice Chancellor). I ended up not wanting to take the position, so I didn't mind not getting an offer.
Interview Questions: No crazy interview questions; just asked about my skill set.

title: Senior Research Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was one interview with three people.  It was not difficult they asked your typical questions.  The three people took turns asking simple questions.  They said they would take a week to make a decision but it did take a little longer. The interview was easy however their human resources department is a little unorganized.  I had to go twice to fill out paper work because they forgot to give me some of the paper work the first time.
Interview Questions: They asked typical questions.  Describe a time you were involved in a work confrontation.  They asked about my skill set.  They also asked me to relate my current job to the position I was applying for.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: new the professor already. Quick question and voila. How well are you comfortable debugging parallel programs. Do you know object oriented programing. The guy didn't know anything beside his fortran 70 and bash script
Interview Questions: math skills, linear algebra, computer science, molecular dynamics, quantum mechanics, parallel programing

title: Senior Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Talked about transfer-ability of previously acquired office training and experience/skills. Noted possible deficiencies and planned remedies. Met with associate deans, met counterparts in departmental offices throughout the building. Agreed to start date and on-the-job training outline.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to switch careers from foodservice to administration?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed at the Thornton Athletic Center. The process involved a face to face interview which involved general questions about my work history, and why I wanted to work there. It wasn't very intense, but you are required to have three or four lengthy recommendations.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the University of Tennessee?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Contacted my adviser through email and the staff from the department got back to me in 2 weeks. Setup an interview with the professor and the department head. The interview was a phone interview and got through.
Interview Questions: Undergrad research related questions

title: Field Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had the advantage of interviewing for a position in which I had more experience than the person who was actually heading the project, so I was told that, essentially, as long as I showed up on time and worked to the fullest, I could consider my acceptance a given.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
first there was an online application and application fee
inperson interview- they paid for my hotel and food
the interview was with multiple professors 
each interview did not last long
took a while to get an offer
once i got the offer i accepted
Interview Questions: why did i want this position and what was my experience

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long and invasive just like this which is why I dont like filling out  more than one question to get to my information more picky than the some of the more difficult background checks I have already gone through which is ridicuolous considering I didn't have a job with them yet
Interview Questions: They were bordering invasive and annoyingly more picky than the some of the more difficult background checks I have already gone through which is ridicuolous considering I didn't have a job with them yet

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: had an on campus interview with two employees at the office I applied for. they were both very nice and knowledgable. one went on to become my boss. the interview was mostly behavioral type questions and common questions asked in interviews such as strengths, weaknesses, etc.
Interview Questions: what are your strengths?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the Bredesen center via the online application system. After one month, I got an email requesting for a Skype interview. The interview was conversational and was centered on my past research experience and my future goals.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experience.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a very welcoming environment. I was asked about hobbies and aspirations. I was also asked how I would handle various potential situations in the job. Many of the situations were very serious, such as how to talk to a depressed student. The interview made me think about various things in my life and prepared me for the job I was applying for.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a depressed student?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Martin, TN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Department chairperson performed interview since this was the person I directly reported to and performed duties within the various programs. The relaxed office setting made the process a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: If you were a tree, what type of tree would you be?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Chattanooga, TN) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Included phone and in person interview. They enquired about my past experirences. About my future goals for teaching. What their expectations were. Interview was pretty easy. Short. And at the end of it was even made an unofficial offer. But later the paper offer didn't match the phone offer.
Interview Questions: My research and teaching experiences

title: Non Tenure Track Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Memphis, TN) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Meet faculties in the department around 30 min each total 7-8 people in the different research area. talk with lab people to query and answer their question, give a presentation in the department and meet  with chair of the department. Finally, tour the city and taste the local food and culture.
Interview Questions: What is your long-term research goal?

title: Counselor/Professional Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by phone to request a phone interview, and again by phone for in-person interview. Was provided an itinerary for the day and was expected to give a 30min presentation. Met with hiring committee, office staff, select university staff, and ate lunch with director. Full reimbursement for travel.
Interview Questions: Was given student scenarios and asked how I would approach the situation. Somewhat like a "case-study" given in graduate school.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Spring Hill, TN) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: One-on-one with project director and was offered internship.I was asked about education and related knowledge to position. I was given a tour of the Research Station and given background on the equine project.
Interview Questions: I was asked about education and related knowledge to position. I was given a tour of the Research Station and given background on the equine project.

title: Research Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Memphis, TN) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied on line, HR called for an interview appointment, met with a panel of managment, later was offered position.  It was in a closed office with 2-3 people asking a variety of job related skills.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good fit and how will your present skills be used?  Are you willing to work hours other than regular M- F?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Met with my future supervisor for a one on one interview.  We had a delightful conversation about what was expected from me as an employee, and what I would need to provide and/or do to secure job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview with HR, than you were invited for a panel interview, if you moved forward you were selected for a one-on-one interview with the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: Previous experience in data base management.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Tennessee in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: describe your research project including participated ones and independent ones. why do you choose this department/university. what's your research interest? and a lot of random chats. overall it's very easy and the whole interveiw was about research experience
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: All contact with the University of Tennessee was very professional and kind. From the very start of the hiring process there were many steps that were clearly explained that needed to be followed throughout the hiring process. The initial interview was panel style. There was one hall director, one assistant hall director, and two current resident assistants. The questions were well thought out, and reasonable. I felt that the initial panel interview was fair.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Faculty In Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Chattanooga, TN) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: Had an all day interview with faculty and staff. Presentation to faculty, staff and students. There was a phone interview months before I was called for onsight. The faculty is very welcoming and the atmosphere there was great.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to a lecturer?

title: IT Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I sent in a resume. They called me in. Showed me around and put me to work. It was strange, but I didn't complain at the time. Boy, was I in for it. I went from a specific set of work expectations as a sys admin to climbing through wire chases and getting bitten by animals at the Vet School
Interview Questions: Can you breathe?

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Tennessee (Knoxville, TN) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: Went through my background as software engineer and discuss the position. He is a senior manager in the team, and is looking for someone who was up to the latest .Net Framework and owned the experience of publicly demonstrate a new technology. I wasn't using .Net 4.0 at the time so I didn't pass the phone interview, but it was good experience to know what aspect they were looking for on a candidate.
Interview Questions: What teaching experience you have in terms of new technology?
